resources.string: A cat\'s whiskers help it hunt at night.
When resting, a cat\'s heart beats nearly twice as fast as a human\'s.
A cat can see in complete darkness.
A cat can jump up to 5 times its own height.
A cat\'s whiskers detects movements of air. This allows them to detect anything moving in the dark.
When resting, a cat\'s heart beats at 110 to 140 beats per minute.
Even though cats can see in the dark, they cannot see in complete darkness. They need a small source of light in order to see.
In one leap, a cat can jump up to 5 times its own height.
A cat\'s kidneys can filter sea salt. This allows them to rehydrate by drinking seawater.
